page.title: 16PACK MONDAY FAIR, SHERBORNE.
page.content: This local tradition goes back to 18th century or earlier. First called Michaelmas Fair, and still held on the first Monday after old Michaelmas day (10th Oct). Name comes from"pact" or agreement made between farmer and worker at these hiring fairs. It was also a cattle and sheep fair. In the 19th century, was announced by urchins blowing cows horns after clock struck midnight. Now a street market and fun fair, it is heralded by a midnight procession of "Teddy Roe's Band". This band is of recent origin but music stems from pagan times when noise was to scare devils. Stalls now in Cheap Street, Half Moon Street and Digby Road. Fun fair on the Terrace. Stalls run by "Cheap-Jacks", selling clothes, fancy goods, household goods and fast food.
